column4: Validate keyless AWS authentication via OIDC

column7: Jobs route to appropriate runner by label

column4: Validate runners scale up on queue depth
column5: Auto-scaling configured; CloudWatch alarms set
column6: 1. Submit 15 concurrent jobs; 2. Monitor CloudWatch; 3. Observe scale-up action; 4. Verify new runners register
column7: Additional runners launch when queue threshold exceeded

column4: Validate runners scale down after idle period

column6: 1. Allow runners to idle 15 min; 2. Monitor CloudWatch; 3. Observe scale-down; 4. Verify minimum maintained
column7: Runners scale down to minimum after idle period

column7: Container image available in GitHub Packages

column4: Validate container image push to AWS ECR

column6: 1. Run Docker build workflow; 2. Authenticate to ECR via OIDC; 3. Push image; 4. Verify in ECR console
column7: Container image available in AWS ECR

column4: Validate Kubernetes deployment to EKS cluster
column5: EKS cluster accessible; kubectl configured; Deployment manifest ready
column6: 1. Run deployment workflow; 2. Execute kubectl apply; 3. Verify pods running; 4. Check service endpoint

column4: Validate production deployment requires approval
column5: Environment protection rules configured; Reviewers assigned

column4: Validate pipeline completes within 10 minutes
column5: Pipeline configured; Sample application ready
column6: 1. Run end-to-end pipeline 10 times; 2. Record duration each run; 3. Calculate average; 4. Compare to 10 min target
column7: Average pipeline duration <10 minutes per SOW

column4: Validate system handles 25+ concurrent builds
column5: Full runner fleet available; Test applications ready
column6: 1. Submit 25 builds simultaneously; 2. Monitor queue depth; 3. Track completion times; 4. Check for failures
column7: All 25 builds complete without queue starvation

column4: Validate BuildKit layer caching improves speed
column5: Docker workflow configured; BuildKit cache enabled
column6: 1. Run Docker build (no cache); 2. Note duration; 3. Run again (with cache); 4. Compare durations
column7: Cached Docker build at least 50% faster

column4: Validate jobs start within 30 seconds
column5: Adequate runner capacity; Normal load conditions
column6: 1. Submit single job; 2. Record queue start time; 3. Record runner pickup time; 4. Calculate queue duration
column7: Job starts execution within 30 seconds of queue

column4: Validate unhealthy runners replaced automatically
column5: ASG health checks configured; Runner registered
column6: 1. Terminate runner instance; 2. Observe ASG health check fail; 3. Verify replacement launches; 4. Confirm runner re-registers
column7: Unhealthy runner replaced within ASG health check period

column4: Validate workflow retry handles transient failures
column5: Retry configuration enabled; Test workflow ready
column6: 1. Inject transient failure; 2. Observe automatic retry; 3. Remove failure; 4. Verify eventual success
column7: Transient failures recovered via automatic retry

column4: Validate OIDC tokens have limited lifetime
column5: OIDC configured; Token inspection capability
column6: 1. Generate OIDC token in workflow; 2. Inspect token expiration; 3. Verify <1 hour lifetime; 4. Attempt use after expiry
column7: OIDC tokens expire within 1 hour

column4: Validate secrets masked in workflow logs
column5: Secrets configured; Test workflow with logging
column6: 1. Configure secret in repo; 2. Echo secret value in workflow; 3. Review workflow logs; 4. Check for masking
column7: Secret values masked as *** in all logs

column4: Validate runners cannot access unauthorized networks
column5: Security groups configured; Network test tools
column6: 1. Attempt external internet access; 2. Verify allowed outbound (GitHub); 3. Test internal VPC access; 4. Verify blocked destinations
column7: Runners have outbound access only to approved destinations

column4: Validate environment secrets only available in context
column5: Environment secrets configured; Multi-env workflow
column6: 1. Access prod secret from dev environment; 2. Verify access denied; 3. Access from prod environment; 4. Verify access granted
column7: Environment secrets accessible only in correct context

column4: Validate platform handles 200 builds per day
column5: Full infrastructure deployed; Build scheduler ready
column6: 1. Schedule 200 builds across 8 hours; 2. Monitor completion rate; 3. Track failures; 4. Check resource utilization
column7: 200 builds/day completed with <5% failure rate

column4: Validate auto-scaling reaches maximum capacity
column5: ASG max set to 30; High load generator
column6: 1. Generate sustained high load; 2. Monitor ASG scaling; 3. Verify 30 runners active; 4. Check job throughput
column7: Auto-scaling reaches 30 runners under load

column4: Validate CI/CD platform meets uptime SLA
column5: Monitoring configured; Baseline period defined
column6: 1. Monitor platform over 7 days; 2. Track GitHub Actions availability; 3. Track runner availability; 4. Calculate uptime percentage
column7: Platform uptime >=99.9% over measurement period

column4: Validate runners distributed across AZs
column5: Multi-AZ ASG configured; Runners deployed
column6: 1. List runner instances; 2. Check AZ distribution; 3. Simulate AZ failure; 4. Verify job routing to surviving AZ
column7: Runners distributed across 2+ AZs for resilience
